segments.text: Welcome to the explainer. Today we are
diving deep into the world of AI
assisted coding. We're going to look at
a methodology that's designed to take
that sometimes unpredictable chaotic
process and turn it into a reliable
systematic workflow. So if you've ever
spent hours working with a large
language model on a really complex
coding task, this quote it probably hits
a little too close to home. You get
these incredible moments of brilliance,
but then the second you hit a context
limit or just change your focus, it
feels like all that progress just
evaporates. It's like you have to start
over every single time. And that right
there is the heart of the AI coding
headache. You know, your work gets
chopped up into pieces. There's no real
systematic way to tackle big features.
And those super important quality
checks, they often get missed. All that
amazing context you built up with the
AI, it just disappears.
But what if what if you could take all
that chaos and turn it into a system
that's predictable and, you know,
reliable? Well, that's exactly the
promise of this workflow. It introduces
a structured approach specifically
designed to fix these exact problems.
Now, this isn't just a handful of
commands. It's a complete four-phase
workflow. You've got explore, plan,
execute, and ship. And the really
important thing here is that each phase
builds directly on the one before it,
creating this clear, logical path from a
vague idea all the way to production
ready code. Okay, so let's break this
down starting right at the beginning
with phase one exploration. You could
argue this is the most critical step of
all because it sets the foundation for
everything that comes after. The goal
here is actually pretty simple, but it's
incredibly powerful. You let the AI do
all the initial heavy lifting. It goes
in, analyzes your requirements, scans
the entire codebase, and flags any
potential roadblocks, and it documents
everything it finds in a superdetailed
file called exploration.md.
So for our example, let's say we want to
add user authentication. We would just
kick the whole thing off with this
simple /explore command. The AI then
just gets right to work analyzing our
whole project to understand the full
context of what we're asking for. All
right, now we get to phase two, the
plan. This is where that initial deep
dive analysis from the exploration phase
gets turned into a real actionable
blueprint. And this is the really cool
part. The output from the explore phase
becomes the direct input for the plan
phase. The system literally takes that
exploration.mmd file and uses it to
break the entire project down into these
ordered verifiable steps. Nothing gets
lost in translation. The command
couldn't be simpler. You just type /pl.
That's it. The system automatically
pulls in all the findings from that
exploration phase and generates a
superdetailed blueprint for the entire
feature. And let's be clear, this is not
just some simple to-do list. We're
talking about a comprehensive
implementation plan. It's got task
dependencies, really specific success
criteria, even risk analysis. This
becomes the exact map that the AI is
going to follow to the letter. So with
our solid plan totally locked in, we can
move from the blueprint to the actual
building. Welcome to phase 3, execute.
This is where the code gets written, but
in a really systematic and verifiable
way. This is where the whole process
really starts to shine. Instead of
getting one massive scary block of code
dropped on you, we use the /next
command. This tells the AI, hey, let's
tackle this plan one task at a time.
Each little step is implemented, it's
verified, and only then is it safely
committed. So every time you run /next,
the AI just picks up the very next task
from our plan. It writes the code, it
runs the tests, and only when everything
passes does it commit the changes with a
nice, clear, descriptive message. And
you just keep running next, next. It's
that simple. The system just moves
through the task list in the right
order, tracking everything as it goes.
You get this really clear, visual update
on your progress with every single
command. Okay, once every single task in
the plan is marked as complete, we hit
the final stage, phase four, ship. This
is all about delivering highquality,
well doumented and productionready code
with total confidence. Think of the ship
command as that final quality gate. It
packages everything up, runs all the
final checks, and can even automatically
generate a pull request for your team to
review, complete with a detailed summary
of all the work that's been done.
This checklist is the perfect picture of
the built-in safety net we're talking
about. The system actually verifies that
every task is done, all the tests are
passing, and the documentation is up to
date before anything gets delivered. It
basically guarantees that what you ship
is exactly what you planned. So, at the
end of the day, this is the
transformation we're talking about.
You're moving away from that chaotic,
forgetful process on the left to the
structured, auditable workflow on the
right. A system where context and
quality are protected through the entire
development cycle. You see, a
methodology like this fundamentally
changes how you work with an AI. It
takes it from being that brilliant but
forgetful assistant and turns it into a
systematic, reliable partner. The AI
handles the step-by-step execution,
which frees you up to focus on the
bigger picture, the architecture. So, it
leaves you with a final question to
think about. What could you build if
your AI partner never forgot the plan?
